metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0056 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The l3-agent in OpenStack Neutron 2012.2 before 2013.2.3 does not check thetenant id when creating ports, which allows remote authenticated users toplug ports into the routers of arbitrary tenants via the device id in aport-create command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0056` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

neutron-common - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-dhcp-agent - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-l3-agent - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-lbaas-agent - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-metadata-agent - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-bigswitch - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-bigswitch-agent - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-brocade - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-cisco - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-hyperv - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-ibm - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-ibm-agent - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-linuxbridge - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-linuxbridge-agent - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-metaplugin - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-metering-agent - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-midonet - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-ml2 - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-mlnx-agent - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-nec - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-nec-agent - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-nicira - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-openflow-agent - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-openvswitch - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-openvswitch-agent - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-plumgrid - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-ryu - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-ryu-agent - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-vmware - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-plugin-vpn-agent - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
neutron-server - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
python-neutron - 1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: neutron package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:2014.1~b3-0ubuntu1').
